intro: Spilotantha zygia, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-green foliage and bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun. It has a taproot system and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Spilotantha zygia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
